TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ObjectListShowCommandsEventArgs extends System.EventArgs

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The System.Web.Mobile.dll assembly has been deprecated and should no longer be used. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=157231.")

Docs.summary: Provides data for the event of an . For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see Mobile Apps & Sites with ASP.NET.

remarks.format:
## Remarks An instance of a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListShowCommandsEventArgs> object is automatically created and passed to the event handler for the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList.ShowItemCommands> event of an <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList>.
An inherited class or event handler can use this event to show commands unique to the item, by changing the collection of commands in the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList.Commands%2A> property.
## Examples For a code sample, see the example for the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList> overview.

Docs.permission: for operating in a hosted environment. Demand value: ; Permission value: .

Public Sub New (item As ObjectListItem, commands As ObjectListCommandCollection)

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see Mobile Apps & Sites with ASP.NET.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Constructs a new <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListShowCommandsEventArgs> object, initializing the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListShowCommandsEventArgs.ListItem%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListShowCommandsEventArgs.Commands%2A> properties with the values of the `item` and `commands` parameters, respectively.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Commands As ObjectListCommandCollection

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the collection of commands in the objects. Initially, the collection is empty. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see Mobile Apps & Sites with ASP.NET.
Docs.value: The collection of commands in the .

remarks.format: ## Remarks You can add or remove commands in the collection by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListCommandCollection.Add%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListCommandCollection.AddAt%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListCommandCollection.Remove%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListCommandCollection.RemoveAt%2A> methods of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListCommandCollection> class. You can use this property to access and modify the commands for a single item in an <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList> object during the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList.ShowItemCommands> event. Changes made do not affect the base collection of commands specified for the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList> object.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ListItem As ObjectListItem

Docs.summary: Returns the list item for the specified commands that will be displayed. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see Mobile Apps & Sites with ASP.NET.
Docs.value: The list item for the specified commands that will be displayed.
